A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Last Jedi is not only an underwhelming addition to the beloved franchise\, which throws out many of the plot elements that made its predecessor so interesting\, it is also a poorly written and directed film in a wider sense. 

Multiple plot lines which pad this film's bloated runtime have zero consequence on the overall story - with two major side plots having so little effect on the film the major events would have remained the same if those sequences had been cut entirely. 

Time and again\, emotional moments are undercut with poor humour that feels out of place even in this post-Abrams trilogy\, or they have no emotional weight to them because something is revealed or changed at the last moment which robs them of their impact. 

The crying shame is that somewhere in this laborious 152 minute slog\, is the core of a great film\, which could have served as a fantastic skeleton for Episode 9 thematically as well as in specific plot points. 

But unfortunately we are left with a poorly constructed effort which fails to build upon the mystery of Episode 7\, throws out much of what made that film great\, and fundamentally changes the core beliefs of characters we have known and loved for decades.
